snippet: A federal judge in Manhattan rejected a request for Nazih Abdul-Hamed al-Ruqai, who faces indictment on conspiracy charges stemming from the 1998 bombing of two United States embassies in East Africa.
abstract: Federal judge in Manhattan rejects request to appoint lawyer to represent terror suspect Nazih Abdul-Hamed al-Ruqai, who faces indictment on conspiracy charges stemming from 1998 bombings of two United States embassies in East Africa that killed 224 people.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge in Manhattan rejected a request for Nazih Abdul-Hamed al-Ruqai, who faces indictment on conspiracy charges stemming from the 1998 bombing of two United States embassies in East Africa.

headline.main: Request to Appoint Lawyer for Terror Suspect Is Denied
headline.print_headline: Request to Appoint Lawyer For Terror Suspect Is Denied
